channel.title: Eat Feed
channel.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
channel.description: The food and cooking podcast that takes you back in time, across the country, around the world, and back to your own table.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Eat Feed is a podcast dedicated to food history as well as local and international cuisine
channel.itunes:summary: Eat Feed is the food and cooking podcast that takes you back in time, across the country, around the world, and back to your own table.

item.title: Eat Feed 42: The Kitchen
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Justin Spring-The Itty Bitty Kitchen Handbook for cooks in 21st century apartments launches us into a look at the kitchen through history and around the world.
item.itunes:subtitle: Forever and Everywhere
item.itunes:summary: Justin Spring-The Itty Bitty Kitchen Handbook for cooks in 21st century apartments launches us into a look at the kitchen through history and around the world.
item.itunes:keywords: Hustin Spring Kitchen Itty Bitty Kitchen Handbook kitchen history

item.title: Eat Feed 41: April in Season
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Asparagus and Going Dutch on a Dinner Party
item.itunes:subtitle: The Tastes of the Month
item.itunes:summary: Asparagus and Going Dutch on a Dinner Party
item.itunes:keywords: Asparagus jenever tulips Holland spring April Dinner Party

item.title: Eat Feed 40: Rites of Spring
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Easter candy for adults and celebrating a traditional Seder with stories and recipes
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter and Passover
item.itunes:summary: Easter candy for adults and celebrating a traditional Seder with stories and recipes
item.itunes:keywords: easter bunny seder holiday spring chocolate kugel

item.title: Eat Feed 39: March in Season
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Spring lamb and celebrating a food hero's birthday
item.itunes:subtitle: The Tastes of the Month
item.itunes:summary: Spring lamb and celebrating a food hero's birthday
item.itunes:keywords: Spring lamb celebrate food hero birthday Cesar Chavez

item.title: Eat Feed 38: Comfort Food
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Sauerkraut, sauerkraut, and more sauerkraut; listeners' favorite comfort food; eating through the winter on the 19th-century American frontier
item.itunes:subtitle: Eating Well in Winter
item.itunes:summary: Sauerkraut, sauerkraut, and more sauerkraut; listeners' favorite comfort food; eating through the winter on the 19th-century American frontier
item.itunes:keywords: Great Lakes Sauerkraut silverfloss krrrrisp kraut sauerkraut comfort food winter 19th-century American frontier

item.title: Eat Feed 37: February in Season
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: The Chocolate Connoisseur by Chloe Doutre-Roussel and a different way to spend Mardi Gras with pancakes
item.itunes:subtitle: Chocolate and Pancakes
item.itunes:summary: The Chocolate Connoisseur by Chloe Doutre-Roussel and a different way to spend Mardi Gras with pancakes
item.itunes:keywords: Chocolate Connoisseur Chloe Doutre-Roussel Mardi Gras pancakes

item.title: Eat Feed 36: The Romance of Food
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: What's Your Food Sign; Simply In Season cookbook review; the history of romantic French dining
item.itunes:subtitle: Valentine's Day
item.itunes:summary: What's Your Food Sign; Simply In Season cookbook review; the history of romantic French dining
item.itunes:keywords: Valentine Day Romance Your Food Sign; Simply In Season cookbook review; the history of romantic French dining

item.title: Eat Feed 35: Dinner from the Oven
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: braises, roasts, and casseroles; history of the TV dinner; book interviews: Lydie Marshall and Slow Cooked Comfort; Laura Shapiro and Something From the Oven
item.itunes:subtitle: Warm Ideas for Cold Nights
item.itunes:summary: braises, roasts, and casseroles; history of the TV dinner; book interviews: Lydie Marshall and Slow Cooked Comfort; Laura Shapiro and Something From the Oven
item.itunes:keywords: TV dinner Lydie Marshall braises roasts casseroles Slow Cooked Comfort Laura Shapiro Something From the Oven

item.title: Eat Feed 34: January in Season
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Winter citrus and Burns Night Supper
item.itunes:subtitle: January
item.itunes:summary: Winter citrus and Burns Night Supper
item.itunes:keywords: Winter citrus Burns Night Supper

item.title: Eat Feed 33: Global Celebrations
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Las Posadas in Mexico, St. Lucia Day in Sweden, Hanukkah in Algeria and Iraq, and Hogmanay in Scotland. Recipes for Swedish gingerbread, spiced wine, and St. Lucia buns as well as Iraqi potatoes with cilantro and almond date balls.
item.itunes:subtitle: Feasting Around the World
item.itunes:summary: Las Posadas in Mexico, St. Lucia Day in Sweden, Hanukkah in Algeria and Iraq, and Hogmanay in Scotland. Recipes for Swedish gingerbread, spiced wine, and St. Lucia buns as well as Iraqi potatoes with cilantro and almond date balls.
item.itunes:keywords: Christmas St. Lucia Day Hanukkah Hogmanay gingerbread spiced wine St. Lucia buns Iraqi potatoes almond date balls

item.title: Eat Feed 32: The Gifted Cook
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Food games and trivia; cocoas, ports, and puddings; gifts from small farmers and for small farmers; homemade gifts from the kitchen
item.itunes:subtitle: An Eclectic Guide to Holiday Giving
item.itunes:summary: Food games and trivia; cocoas, ports, and puddings; gifts from small farmers and for small farmers; homemade gifts from the kitchen
item.itunes:keywords: Christmas gift holiday foodie game trivia cocoa small farm homemade

item.title: Eat Feed 31: A Baker's Dozen
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Delicious chocolate desserts, tips for the best pie crust, history of the cookie in America and a club devoted to British puddings, three new cookbooks and the great bakers behind them
item.itunes:subtitle: 13 Baking Highlights for the Holiday Season
item.itunes:summary: Delicious chocolate desserts, tips for the best pie crust, history of the cookie in America and a club devoted to British puddings, three new cookbooks and the great bakers behind them
item.itunes:keywords: Foraging London British regional cuisine Scotch Malt Whisky Society Cullen Skink Yorkshire Parkin Cornish Pasties

item.title: Eat Feed 30: The British Countryside
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Foraging for food in the woods south of London; tasting British regional cuisine; the Scotch Malt Whisky Society; recipes for Cullen Skink, Yorkshire Parkin, and Cornish Pasties
item.itunes:subtitle: Exploring Regional Cuisine
item.itunes:summary: Foraging for food in the woods south of London; tasting British regional cuisine; the Scotch Malt Whisky Society; recipes for Cullen Skink, Yorkshire Parkin, and Cornish Pasties
item.itunes:keywords: Foraging London British regional cuisine Scotch Malt Whisky Society Cullen Skink Yorkshire Parkin Cornish Pasties

item.title: Eat Feed 29: Thanksgiving
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Whether you long for colonial inspirations, Victorian traditions, or 20th century innovations, this episode is your guide to a historically inspired meal. Guest: Sandy Oliver, co-author of Giving Thanks: Thanksgiving Recipes and History, from Pilgrims to Pumpkin Pie.
item.itunes:subtitle: The History of America's Favorite Meal
item.itunes:summary: Whether you long for colonial inspirations, Victorian traditions, or 20th century innovations, this episode is your guide to a historically inspired meal. Guest: Sandy Oliver, co-author of Giving Thanks: Thanksgiving Recipes and History, from Pilgrims to Pumpkin Pie.
item.itunes:keywords: Thanksgiving Sandy Oliver turkey Victorian stuffing dressing gravy Pilgrim Puritan colonial

item.title: Eat Feed 28: Autumn Harvest
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Cooking up the taste of the season: Pumpkins, Cranberries, Apples, Wild Rice, and great spices like cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. Step-by-step making caramel at home and a recipe for cranberry cream muffins.
item.itunes:subtitle: A Celebration of Autumn Flavors
item.itunes:summary: Cooking up the taste of the season: Pumpkins, Cranberries, Apples, Wild Rice, and great spices like cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. Step-by-step making caramel at home and a recipe for cranberry cream muffins.
item.itunes:keywords: Pumpkins halloween Cranberry Apple Wild Rice spice cinnamon nutmeg clove caramel cranberry cream muffins

item.title: Eat Feed 27: A Culinary Passage to India
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: 500 years of Indian food from the Moghuls to the British; the globalization of Indian food in the 21st century; hot Indian restaurants in London and their secret recipes; Indian tea from Darjeeling to Assam. And don't forget the Walkers shortbread giveaway!
item.itunes:subtitle: From Chai to Chaat
item.itunes:summary: 500 years of Indian food from the Moghuls to the British; the globalization of Indian food in the 21st century; hot Indian restaurants in London and their secret recipes; Indian tea from Darjeeling to Assam. And don't forget the Walkers shortbread giveaway!
item.itunes:keywords: Indian food garden Moghuls British London Indian tea Darjeeling Assam

item.title: Eat Feed 26: Food on the Homefront
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Feed gives away Walkers shortbread. Braised pork shoulder with grapes in a WWI crock; Rachel Laudan on Victory Gardens and post-war desserts; Jennifer Wilkins on food citizenship and food security; and your ideas for homefront drinks.
item.itunes:subtitle: Eating in a Time of War
item.itunes:summary: Feed gives away Walkers shortbread. Braised pork shoulder with grapes in a WWI crock; Rachel Laudan on Victory Gardens and post-war desserts; Jennifer Wilkins on food citizenship and food security; and your ideas for homefront drinks.
item.itunes:keywords: war victory garden Rachel Jennifer Wilkins citizenship security

item.title: Eat Feed 25: A Moveable Feast
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Russell Cronkhite and his cookbook A Return to Family Picnics, menus for autumn picnic, tailgate party, or outdoor meal of cordon bleu subs; Robin Campbell and Mary Ellen Hern-history American picnics; Tim Elliot picnic wine
item.itunes:subtitle: Autumn Dining in the Great Outdoors
item.itunes:summary: Russell Cronkhite and his cookbook A Return to Family Picnics, menus for autumn picnic, tailgate party, or outdoor meal of cordon bleu subs; Robin Campbell and Mary Ellen Hern-history American picnics; Tim Elliot picnic wine
item.itunes:keywords: picnic Cronkhite Robin Campbell Ellen Hern tailgate party autumn Tim Elliott

item.title: Eat Feed 24: Preserving the Past
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Making the most of today's bounty by storing it for the future. Sue Shephard's Pickled, Potted, and Canned; June Taylor and her amazing historically-inspired line of preserves; and Tim Elliott from Winecast on wine as the preserved grape.
item.itunes:subtitle: Pickles, jams, and Other Preserves
item.itunes:summary: Making the most of today's bounty by storing it for the future. Sue Shephard's Pickled, Potted, and Canned; June Taylor and her amazing historically-inspired line of preserves; and Tim Elliott from Winecast on wine as the preserved grape.
item.itunes:keywords: preservation jam pickle ham wine Sue Shephard pickles June Taylor Tim Elliott

item.title: Eat Feed 23: Revolutionary Taste
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: The tastes, trends, food, and fads that have revolutionized the way we eat: exploration, the printing press, ice, measuring cups, organic awareness, ancient grains, cooking at home, small farms, and even more big ideas. Sherri Brooks Vinto's The Real Food Revival; the country's first Curator of American Culinary History, Jan Longone; and Mark Prince from the Coffee Geek Podcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: Food Movements that Have Changed the World
item.itunes:summary: The tastes, trends, food, and fads that have revolutionized the way we eat: exploration, the printing press, ice, measuring cups, organic awareness, ancient grains, cooking at home, small farms, and even more big ideas. Sherri Brooks Vinton's The Real Food Revival; the country's first Curator of American Culinary History, Jan Longone; and Mark Prince from the Coffee Geek Podcast.
item.itunes:keywords: organic farmers market scientific measurement exploration longone brooks vinton

item.title: Eat Feed 22: Fresh from the Field
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: A late-summer harvest of Iowa corn, historic tomatoes, and fruit-filled drinks; Jeremy Jackson's The Cornbread Book, Andy Smith's The Tomato in America, and Sandy Oliver on the colonial beverage called shrub
item.itunes:subtitle: Late-Summer Bounty
item.itunes:summary: A late-summer harvest of Iowa corn, historic tomatoes, and fruit-filled drinks; Jeremy Jackson's The Cornbread Book, Andy Smith's The Tomato in America, and Sandy Oliver on the colonial beverage called shrub
item.itunes:keywords: corn tomato harvest shrub jackson smith iowa cornbread oliver

item.title: Eat Feed 21: A Culinary Independence: Jefferson for July 4th
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Discussions of the cookbook Dining at Monticello: In Good Taste and Abundance; Jefferson's vanilla ice cream recipe; tomatoes, winter wheat, and pastured beef; the culinary and cooking innovations of the third US president.
item.itunes:subtitle: Historic Meals for the Fourth of July
item.itunes:summary: Discussions of the cookbook Dining at Monticello: In Good Taste and Abundance; Jefferson's vanilla ice cream recipe; tomatoes, winter wheat, and pastured beef; the culinary and cooking innovations of the third US president.
item.itunes:keywords: food Jefferson Independence July 4th fourth Monticello tomato vanilla ice cream winter wheat pastured beef

item.title: Eat Feed 20: The Flavors and Foods of Hawaii
item.itunes:author: Anne Bramley
item.description: Poi, pineapple, and poke. Fresh fish, exotic fruits, and traditions and trends in the Pacific Rim culinary world. Hawaii Regional Cuisine and island farmers markets. Interviews with food writer, Joan Namkoong, and chef, Peter Merriman.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cooking and Cuisine in Hawaii
item.itunes:summary: Poi, pineapple, and poke. Fresh fish, exotic fruits, and traditions and trends in the Pacific Rim culinary world. Hawaii Regional Cuisine and island farmers markets. Interviews with food writer, Joan Namkoong, and chef, Peter Merriman.
item.itunes:keywords: food Hawaii fish poi pineapple poke Namkoong Merriman

item.title: Eat Feed 19: Ice Cream Through the Ages
item.description: Coffee ice cream, tea ice cream, marmalade ice cream, Thomas Jefferson's vanilla ice cream, even artichoke and Parmesan ice cream. Ice cream molded like a peach and ice cream painted like a fish. Sabatieres and hand crank machines. Ice cream socials and ice cream parlors. And the author of Ice Cream: The Ultimate in Cold Comfort.

item.title: The Art of Breakfast
item.description: Tasting the forgotten meal of the day: blue, green, and even purple free-range eggs from Fickle Creek Farm; tasting the best bacon with the blogger Bacontarian; putting it all together with Maryana Vollstedt and her Big Book of Breakfast; recipes for Sticky Bun French Toast and Brunch Bake

item.title: Naples in New York
item.description: )Owner Giovanni Iovine and Executive Chef Giuliano Materese from New York's Borgo Antico restaurant; Italian wine recs with Tim Elliot of Winecast; pre-anouncing our summer Farmer's Market recipe contest.

item.title: Food and Philosophy on the Left Coast
item.description: Design and create your own vintage at Crushpad Winery in San Francisco; artisanal cheeses from California at the Cheese Board Collective; kid's meals redesigned by Ecoliteracy.

item.title: The French Flavors of Cinco de Mayo
item.description: French food in 19th century Mexico; the battle between Mexican corn and Spanish wheat; and homemade sour cream for your Cinqo de Mayo feast.

item.title: Mediterranean Seder
item.description: Spain, Italy, and Greece on the Passover Table; author Joyce Goldstein; Kosher wine recommendations for the Holiday.

item.title: Tastes of Vermont
item.description: Claudia Clark of Moosewood Hollow creates an innovative twist on maple syrup; Thomas Christopher Greene takes us into the pages of fictional foodie Vermont with the novel I'll Never Be Long Gone

item.title: Gastronomic Georgian England
item.description: the curious world of flummery and syllabub, dinner with William Wordsworth, an ice cream craze, and 18th-century celebrity chefs.

item.title: Eating and Drinking to Save the World
item.description: Drinking beer and eating chocolate to save the world. Growing your own and eating the landscape.

item.title: Easter
item.description: leg of lamb with roasted vegetables and the perfect wines to go with it plus Bill Niman from Niman Ranch, the secret life of home-schooled chickens, and paring knife reviews

item.title: ireland
item.description: recipes from Ballymaloe Cookery School, smoked salmon from Woodcock Smokery, and artisanal cheese from Gubbeen, as well as beer recs for St. Patrick's Day

item.title: Soup
item.description: soup cookbooks, vegetarian soups, soups from Zimbabwe and inspired by Mexico; plus recipes and how-to's for homebrews

item.title: Scandinavia
item.description: New Scandinavian Cooking with Andreas Viestad, wine pairings with Tim Elliot of Winecast, shopping for kitchens and food at Ikea, Viking-strength spirits

item.title: Chicago
item.description:
The Culinary Low-Down on Chi-Town
The tastes of Chicago: Windy City hot dogs a.k.a. Garden on a Bun, Polish home cooking, stuffed pizza on a soapbox, and the voices of Chicago food lovers

item.title: Chocolate
item.description:
Food of the Gods: A Sacred History of Chocolate
3,000 years of chocolate, chocolate tastings, chocolate desserts, chocolate insight. What percent is your chocolate packin'?

item.title: Valentines
item.description: Husband and wife champscast. Ideas for Valentines cooking: steak with brandy cream sauce, meringues, caviar potatoes, and Kir Royale cocktails. Folks around the world give their ideas for V-Day food. And, as always, food trivia.

item.title: Easy Japanesey
item.description: Easy Japanese meals to make at home: soba, curry, green tea ice cream, tonkatsu, and marinated fish. Plus the theory of rice.

item.title: Beyond Cheeseheads
item.description: This week's podcast takes us to Wisconsin where we talk with regional food specialists. Hmong cuisine ingredients and restaurants, Scandinavian influences, church suppers, fish boils, and great beer and cheese.

item.title: At Shakespeares Table
item.description: This week's show is dedicated to cooking and feasting like a Renaissance man or woman. There's a Twelfth Night feast and a Pancake Day party. Recipes for venison pasties, wassail, Shrove Tuesday pancakes, and more.
item.category: food, cooking, food history, entertaining, recipes
